## What is Rstudio? 

--

 Rstudio is an interface for R, which makes it much easier and faster to use R  

--
 
## What is R?  

--

R is both a programming language _and_ the software that interprets the scripts  
Once R and Rstudio installed, work in Rstudio, which interfaces with R  
Will need to update them periodically (update both!)  

---


###There are four 'panes' in Rstudio    


1. Source 

2. Console

3. Environment/History

4. Plots/Files/Packages/Help/Viewer

###There are four 'panes' in Rstudio  
--

1. Source: write code

2. Console: run code

3. Environment/History: shows objects in workspace (Environment) and your command history (History)

4. Plots/Files/Packages/Help/Viewer

class:inverse

###There are four 'panes' in Rstudio  
--

1. Source: write code

2. Console: run code

3. Environment/History: shows objects in workspace (Environment) and your command history (History)

4. Plots/Files/Packages/Help/Viewer: shows plots, navigate to files/directories, install packages, get help

### Why R

--

R is great for reproducibility  
No pointing and clicking!  
R works on data of all shapes and sizes (and for the most part, types)  
R produces high-quality graphics  
Large, welcoming, helpful community  
Free, open source, cross-platform

--

**It is the standard in ecology/physiology**
